About Me

A bit about myself and my formal Education.

BIO

My Name is Ruaraidh Canaway and i am a recent University graduate looking to make my impact on the programming world, I have studied Computer Games Application Development at Abertay University. Despite studying a games programming course, games is not where my passion lies, I love the art of programming itself and I am looking for a career that truly lets me explore the limits of programming.

Abertay University (2017 - 2020)

Bsc(Hons) in Computer Games Application Development (2:1)

I attended Abertay University in Dundee to study games programming, achieving an honours qualification. This was a fantastic learning experience, the course covered a wide variety of skills required by any programmer not just for games. Covering fundamental and complicated programming structures and algorithms, using the C++ Language, The University granted the opportunity to create a game as part of a team of multiple disciplined, for an outside client. Learning valuable experience for working in a team in the future.

Forth Valley College Falkirk (2014 - 2017)

HND Software Development (A)

I studied Software Development at Forth Valley college in Falkirk. Achieving a Higher level education before moving onto a HND. There i learned a variety of core skills, including Java Programming and SQL, where i achieved Oracle Certifications in both. Time was spent covering, extra computing skills such as Linux, Ethical Hacking, Web Development and more.

Balfron High School (2005 - 2011)

Intermediate Level Education (A)

I Attended Balfron for the full duration achieving a standard education at an Intermediate 2 level upon graduating.
